p: In fastening the stone to the ring with the screw, I pulled too tight and fractured the yellow stone. Only a faint hair line of fracture was visible, and it seemed hardly likely to give way. But for this, the set would have stood up under the blow it gat; also, without the blow it would probably have held indefinitely. The plan for fastening was excellecnt, as it involved no use of cement.
Please return the ring and I'll set another stone. This time I'll not fracture it in fastening, and
it will hold forever. I'll probably use all amethyst, or maybe pale amethyst with a new garnet top.
Evidently the ring is too light. If you want it slightly enlarged, tell me.
We've had lovely rains in time, and the place is all cozily green.
Jed Smith is in page proofs, and should soon be in plates. The N.Y. Times announced it lately.
Had you heard of the war in Europe? It seems the Dutch and the Rooshian's are having a little argument.
Buy a bond today and own a share of America.
